ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about the history of Spain and how this relates to Spain's situation in the present day.

This class is a broad overview on the cultures of Spain, focused particularly on the Spanish government. I learned a lot about Spain's history and the different groups that have lived in the Iberian Peninsula. Although this class did not particularly strengthen my spoken Spanish, I did finish the semester writing an 8 page final paper in Spanish!
Practice with spoken Spanish in an academic setting, insight into the cultures of Spain.
I definitely gained a better understanding of Spanish history and culture and further developed my Spanish writing and reading comprehension skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course could be improved had there been more prep or check-ins regarding our final paper. 8-10 pages in Spanish can be pretty daunting, especially if that length of a paper is challenging even in English. Other than that, I really enjoyed the small lecture style of the class and material covered. I do wish bi-weekly quizzes let us drop our lowest grade.
This course was absolutely amazing! It gave me a great overview of the history and cultures of Spain without being too dry or memorization-heavy. All the discussions were had were very interesting.
Good L5 class, managing to be interesting/engaging and cover a lot while keeping workload and readings to a minimum.

The strength of this course were in its structure; we covered a lot of interesting topics that did not first come to mind when I think of Spain, and the class provided analysis about Spain's everchanging relationships with its ex-colonies as well as with Europe.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I thought this was great and provided the opportunity to explore a lot of areas of Spanish history and culture. That being said, if you're looking for a lot of depth this might not be the best class for you.

I really enjoyed this course! As an ER&M major, I was even able to have it cross-list toward those requirements. I would recommend this course because the material was interesting, expectations were clear, and the workload was manageable.
Yes, 100%. Best Spanish course at Yale.
Yes, if looking for an interesting L5 class with manageable workload.
